items.content: Welligent, a fast-growing Electronic Health Record (EHR) software vendor based in Norfolk, is seeking an experienced mobile application developer to develop and support custom-developed Welligent apps. A leading national software vendor, Welligent provides a comprehensive, enterprise cloud-based software solution which comprises practice management, clinical, billing and reporting functions. Ancillary to its cloud-based solutions, Welligent also offers mobile apps which offer a sub-set of functionality or complementary functionality to our cloud-based solutions. Welligent's customers include community-based behavioral/health and human services providers in more than 30 states. Our company culture and environment has the excitement of a start-up with the intensity of a growing healthcare information technology company solving national issues. There is a pervasive sense that the work we do is making a big impact in the lives of our customers and those they serve.Job Duties Serve as the primary app developer and responsible for app design and UI, all development, testing, debugging and on-going enhancements Lead Welligent's mobile development initiatives as the primary app developer and grow Welligent's mobile practice area Responsible for the ongoing evolution of our existing mobile apps, to enhance functionality and provide a better experience for end users Working within our existing application frameworks, provide creative input, expertise and technical methods Make a significant impact by working directly with the company and product owners, developers and other team members to improve upon an existing strong enterprise application with an extensive national user base Work with the business users to understand and document functionality requirements Collaborate with other technical team members including Welligent's web-services team to understand/ensure data requirements are met As needed, perform business and data requirements gathering and data analysis tasks Identify and document relevant data design, process and specifications Willingness to understand business context and problems and communicate them clearly in written and oral format Requirements Bachelor's degree required Advanced knowledge/experience with Angular with Javascript Advanced knowledge/experience with Cordova and plugins Knowledge of jQuery, Ionic, FullCalendar framework Must be familiar with PouchDB integration for SQLite Experience with SQLite offline storage Basic knowledge of TypeScript Basic knowledge of C++ for comping Windows package Must be familiar with NodeJs package manager PHP (must be familiar with curl basic authentications) Data encryption - AES, Hash NodeJs, must be familiar with package manager using the command line Sass (a plus but not needed since UI already built) User interface design and front end development experience Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with Android Studio, Xcode/Swift, Visual Studio Experience with Apple, Google, and Microsoft store submission process and knowledge of creating and publishing provisioning profiles and certificates for all platforms. Must be familiar with HTTP services Some knowledge of Red Hat Linux server, basic knowledge of command line connection using SSH Knowledge of relational database design Ability to work independently and solve complex software problems Strong analytical and problem solving skills Knowledge of Healthcare IT, EHR/EMR or clinical systems preferred Experience working in a small team to build and enhance complex enterprise software applications Green card or US Citizenship required BenefitsIn addition to health, dental and 401K benefits, Welligent's competitive perks and benefits include the potential for year-end bonus, flexible work schedule, casual office environment in an up-and-coming area of Norfolk near Old Dominion University, no dress code, Starbucks coffee and an amazing group of co-workers.

items.title: Senior Web Developer (Node.JS/Angular) - REMOTE
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=2, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=82, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=58}
items.content:
Resource 1 is seeking a Sr. Web Developer (Node.JS/Angular) for a contract position in Elkridge, MD.

Ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of experience with Node.JS and at least 7 years of experience designing, implementing and supporting web-based applications while adhering to design/development best practices and security standards. This individual will also need to have experience with Angular/Typescript (version 2 or above) and other Front End technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML, JSON).Selected candidate will join a team responsible for an application used for authentication management (setting up permissions/access for other users). Initial development will be on the middle tier with Node.JS and RESTful APIs, then move into UI development with Angular.

Ideal candidate would have experience developing in Angular and Node.JS within a MS Azure platform. MS Azure is not required for this position, but it is a plus. Candidates who have experience with the MEAN/MERN stack would be a good fit for this position. Looking for a senior resource with strong communication skills who can make sound technical decisions, think into the future to anticipate potential needs and obstacles, solve problems and add additional insight. This is an Agile development methodology environment, so relevant work experience is preferred. SQL Server development experience is a plus.

Technical Skills: Web Development, UI Development, Full-Stack Development, Middle Tier Development, Angular 2+, Typescript, Node.JS, JavaScript, Azure, NGRX, HTML, CSS, XML, JSON, Web Services (RESTful APIs) & SQL Server.

items.content:
Resource 1 is seeking a Node.JS Developer for a remote contract position. Ideally, candidate would spend the first few weeks onsite in Elkridge, Maryland prior to transitioning to 100% remote. Resource 1 is seeking a server-oriented, Back End, Node.JS Developer. Candidate should have at least 5 years of full life cycle development of web-based applications. Candidate should be familiar with Server Side JavaScript development, web services API integration (REST/JSON/XML), Back End JS frameworks and writing Server Side web application logic in JavaScript/Node.JS. Individual should also have solid experience with a Node ORM (eg Sequelize or Persistence.js). Position will leverage technologies from the MEAN (MongoDB/Express.JS/Angular/Node.JS ) stack, with an emphasis on Server Side/Back End development. Candidate should also possess basic SQL programming abilities, as well as, cloud services (AWS or Azure). Some web UI development with Angular/TypeScript is also highly desirable for this position. Looking for someone with strong communication skills who can make sound technical decisions, think into the future to anticipate potential needs and obstacles. This is an Agile development methodology environment, so relevant work experience is preferred.

Technical Skills: Node.JS (Server Side) Development, JavaScript, Web Services (RESTful APIs) UI Development, Express.JS, CSS, XML, JSON, Angular 2+, Typescript, HTML, & SQL.

Resource 1 is seeking a server-oriented, Back End, Node.JS Developer. Candidate should have at least 5 years of full life cycle development of web-based applications. Candidate should be familiar with Server Side JavaScript development, web services API integration (REST/JSON/XML), Back End JS frameworks and writing Server Side web application logic in JavaScript/Node.JS. Individual should also have solid experience with a Node ORM (eg Sequelize or Persistence.js). Position will leverage technologies from the MEAN (MongoDB/Express.JS/Angular/Node.JS ) stack, with an emphasis on Server Side/Back End development. Candidate should also possess basic SQL programming abilities, as well as, cloud services (AWS or Azure). Some web UI development with Angular/TypeScript is also highly desirable for this position. Looking for someone with strong communication skills who can make sound technical decisions, think into the future to anticipate potential needs and obstacles. This is an Agile development methodology environment, so relevant work experience is preferred.

Technical Skills: Node.JS (Server Side) Development, JavaScript, Web Services (RESTful APIs) UI Development, Express.JS, CSS, XML, JSON, Angular 2+, Typescript, HTML, & SQL.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer, Extensibility
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer, Extensibility

Auth0’s mission is to help developers innovate faster. Every company is becoming a software company and developers are at the center of this shift. They need better tools and building blocks so they can stay focused on innovating. One of these building blocks is identity: authentication and authorization. That’s what we do. Our platform handles 2.5B logins per month for thousands of customers around the world. From indie makers to Fortune 500 companies, we can handle any use case. We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer. We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work.  is critical to us, and we are transparent about our . Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer! Auth0 provides the simplest and most secure identity platform for developers to make the internet safer. We believe in crafted software, in end-to-end ownership of projects and hyper-fast iterations. The company continues to grow rapidly and services major startups and enterprise customers. We are processing hundreds of millions of logins for thousands of customers from startups to big organizations. We are looking for a Senior Engineer to join our Extensibility team to help us enhance our existing product and add new features. The Extensibility Engineer is responsible for solving complex challenges related to allowing customization in the authentication pipeline. As such, the team owns the core internal technology that allows Auth0 to execute untrusted customer code at scale in isolation--one of the first serverless or FaaS platforms that was built in the industry. You can read more about Auth0 Extensibility .

We:

    • Are remote-by-design. Work from anywhere, your office is The Internet (but we also have multiple physical locations around the world).
    • Obsess about delivering customer value. Everything we do assumes we only succeed if our customers do.
    • Trust and respect each other. Building a new product is like hacking a new path through the jungle. We’ve got your back. We expect the same from you. We respect our differences and use them to our advantage.
    • Hold ourselves to high standards. We take pride in work done well, and constantly push ourselves towards personal betterment.
    • Collaborate by nature. We believe a team is bigger than the sum of its parts.
    • Innovate through experiments, failure, and learning. Failure is part of our process, no blame attached.
    • Are transparent. We are making an explicit effort to share all data relevant to the making of better decisions. No politics.  
    • Bring passion to everything we do. Our common driver is trying to accomplish something meaningful.

You will:

    • Design, build, and maintain extensibility solutions for internal and external services
    • Debug production issues across multiple levels of our stack
    • Collaborate with high caliber engineers to build new features at large-scale
    • Improve the reliability, monitoring, and operations of our serverless platform
    • Refine engineering practices, standards, and tooling

You might work on:

    • Adding new extensibility points to our platform (think Rules and Hooks)
    • Enhancing the underlying technology for Auth0 Extensibility (Webtasks)
    • Creating new Auth0 Extensions that expand the capabilities of the product
    • Monitoring distributed systems that need to communicate well and maintain high availability

You might be a good fit for this role if you:

      • Have a history of developing and supporting intuitive and robust extensibility solutions
      • Are familiar with the challenges and approaches for designing interconnected, scalable systems
      • Take an iterative approach to development, dividing long-term goals into incremental milestones
      • Thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment
      • Have familiarity with the tools we currently use, such as Node.js, Docker, and AWS. (We always try to use the best tool for the job, and therefore regard general engineering skill over knowledge of a particular language or tool. That said, a majority of our existing codebase leverages Node and React, so some level of proficiency in those technologies is highly encouraged)
      • Have experience working in a global remote-first organization
      • Place a high value on security

It’s not expected that a single candidate has expertise in all these areas. We’re looking for professional engineers, who can quickly learn and adapt as our systems and situation changes, rather than candidates with a rigid skill set. You can learn more about our hiring process.

Preferred Locations:

    • GMT-5; GMT-4; GMT-3; GMT-2; GMT; GMT+1

Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Apply now

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Vue, JavaScript, MEAN, MongoDB, eXpress, Vue.js, Node.js, REACT, AWS, Angular

Job Type: Full Time, Permanent
Job Title: Full Stack Developer
Job Location: Boston - Remote
Job Salary: Above Market Base + Benefits + 401K perks
Job Requirements: MEAN Stack, MEVN Stack, JavaScript

We are a growing company in the health care/pharmaceutical industry that has had major success and massive sales revenue with our cutting edge health platform. This is a unique opportunity for candidates to be on the cutting edge of new product development within the patient support space.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Competitive salary range + significant bonus potential + full benefits + stock options + Flexible PTO policy + Ideal location in downtown Boston + Sponsored wellness program, mobility within the company

What You Will Be Doing

- Build and maintain a state-of-the-art platform in the health/pharma industry
- Build a scalable web applications to build a secure, high-performing web application and back-end to address a complex and evolving set of business requirements
- Mentor other developers and assist in growing their skills and becoming contributing members of a high-velocity agile team

What You Need for this Position

- Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience required.
- Javascript (ES6 and beyond)
- One or more popular presentation libraries (Vue, Angular, React, etc.)
- Document-based data modeling - proficiency both conceptually (normal forms, non-relational, etc.) and in practice (experience w/ MongoDB or other document-based databases).
- RESTful API design
- Must be a full-stack developer, able to implement everything in a MEAN or MEVN stack paradigm
- Experience with microservices architecture - moleculer preferred
- Familiarity with HIPAA and related requirements for handling of sensitive data (e.g., encryption in motion and at rest, etc.)
- Experience with cloud paradigms and deployments (e.g., AWS)
- Experience with server-side caching mechanisms (e.g., Redis, etc.)
- Experience with the Linux operating system (e.g., Debian/Ubuntu)
- Experience with GIT-based source management (Stash, Bitbucket, etc.)

What's In It for You

- Competitive salary range + significant bonus potential + full benefits + stock options + Flexible PTO policy + Ideal location in downtown Boston + Sponsored wellness program, mobility within the companySo, if you are a Full Stack Software Engineer - MEAN Stack with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
